padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1403569">fragrance lvvvv</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-15">08/15/22 05:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love at first sniff! <br />
<br />
Milky, soft, fresh, feminine, slightly warm but not too much at all and clean. Truly divine! <br />
<br />
Easy fragrance to wear day to day but special enough to wear on a date. Sits close to skin but able to smell it throughout the day with good sillage. <br />
<br />
Compliment getter!! I LOVE!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1624011"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1624011#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1615132" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1615132" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="betsyglez8"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247249"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1247249.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="betsyglez8" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Nobile-1942/Petali-e-Spade-74679.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.74679.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Petali e Spade"title="Petali e Spade"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1615132ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1615132" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1247249">betsyglez8</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-08-01">08/01/22 21:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Interesting fragrance , <br />
Supposed to be green but I feel its green and nutty ,<br />
Enjoying the lilys and the green notes ,<br />
I like that almondy touch it has .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1615132"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1615132#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1601517" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1601517" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Eribert"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1302689"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1302689.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Eribert" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1601517ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1601517" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1302689">Eribert</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-07-12">07/12/22 07:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Inflorescence starts off as a beautifully sparkling green and white floral. Underneath there is a medium current of good lemon reminiscent of Chanel Cristalle Eau Verte.<br />
<br />
After the sparkle is gone around 2-3 hours in, it turns into an  expensive lemonade fragrance (think of Sprite or Mitsuya Cider but high-quality), that leans female, but not in a coquettish way. Also, you do get a defined undercurrent of white florals - could be jasmine but not sure - that I find exceptionally lovely.<br />
<br />
When I had to wash off the fragrance after roughly 6 hours, it was still moderately strong.<br />
<br />
Inflorescence is an exciting fragrance - ageless, elegant, refreshing, interesting, yet wearable. Its a beautiful summer scent for female (or somewhat gender-nonconforming) professionals.<br />
<br />
To be honest, the only reason I will not buy it is the price. Where I live its about 330.- for 100ml and this much it is not worth to me quality-wise. Firstly, because with Cristalle Eau Verte Chanel offers a great-yet-cheaper alternative and secondly, because I keep on thinking I could get a Frederic Malle for that same money.<br />
<br />
Of course, this is just my personal set of limits, but for me to pay over 300.- for 100ml (or less) of a juice, it must be overwhelming, not just very good.<br />
<br />
However, if the price point does not concern you, do consider  Byredos Inflorescence. <br />
TL;DR: Well-blended sparkling white lemonade </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1601517"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1601517#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1590059" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1590059" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="nebbe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/757949"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.757949.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="nebbe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-Guilty-Eau-de-Toilette-65553.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.65553.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette"title="Gucci Guilty Eau de Toilette"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1590059ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1590059" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/757949">nebbe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-23">06/23/22 11:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I thought I liked it at first, at application it feels like sticking your head into a cool florist fridge. Very atmospheric. After 10ish minutes it is very white-flowery. I like jasmine, but this isn't my favorite jasmine. It's a little cloying to me. <br />
<br />
For the price I would not recommend as a blind buy. As a free sample it was the right price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1590059"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1590059#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1580332" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1580332" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Smellgoodallthetime"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362385"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Smellgoodallthetime" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Delina-Exclusif-50370.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50370.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Delina Exclusif"title="Delina Exclusif"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1580332ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1580332" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1362385">Smellgoodallthetime</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-06-08">06/08/22 12:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I thought it smelled like window cleaner and Im glad Im not the only one ^-^ ( someone mentioned dish soap or furniture polish. Thats also a fair comparison). Its not offensive, its just not something I can imaging applying to my body to smell like perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1580332"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1580332#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1573130" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1573130" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vannya_p"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1511386"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="vannya_p" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1573130ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1573130" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1511386">vannya_p</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-05-28">05/28/22 23:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not like Jasmine perfume I've used before, Jasmine is not the dominant note in this one. Its a combination of white flowers and a barely noticeable rose as well. Smell like a mist of fresh-cut flower concoction yet it has little green from the flower stem. Or it smell like freshly watered flower garden in spring that touched your skin. Smell familiar like flower dish soap, fresh linen, or mature baby cologne. Not long-lasting but it smells rare and realistic to flowers and you can smell the jasmine after the perfume dry-down. Bought this perfume during my business trip to South Korea and everytime I smell it, it reminds me of my spring-summer 3 months trip in Korea, also it does smell like the perfume that Korean girls wear- soft, barely noticeable, and smell like flowery soap. Definitely overpriced for the price of Byredo but I can't find the similarity to other perfumes. Oh! it also smell like a modern cotagecore and Monet's painting &lt;3</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1573130"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1573130#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1562655" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Even there's not a citrus mention in the notes I personally get lots of lemon here.<br />
It is nice for the summer, but definitely check out for a better price.<br />

padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1527049" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NDStars"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259949"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1259949.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NDStars" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1527049ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1527049" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1259949">NDStars</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-20">03/20/22 12:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First blast of sharp green limes and grapefruit in soda water, acidic and bubbly, cold. After a minute, the sharp cold is still there but now the florals step forward, equally lily of the valley and freesia. I also get a faint weird note of black pepper sometimes. All in all, not typical cloying floral but it does remind me of floor cleaner sometimes. Feminine and best for a super hot summer day.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1527049"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1527049#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1522492" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1522492" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LeahElskerParfyme"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1470345"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1470345.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LeahElskerParfyme" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1522492ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1522492" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.83); Since it is quite simple and straightforward, this perfume is kinda overpriced for me.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1522492"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1522492#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1519410" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1519410" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="fpih"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14977"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.14977.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="fpih" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lancome/Oud-Bouquet-39739.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39739.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Bouquet"title="Oud Bouquet"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1519410ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1519410" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/14977">fpih</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2022-03-09">03/09/22 00:31</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Prominent lily of the valley which I like; a very nostalgic scent. Hardly memorable though, or long lasting. However, I wore it above Byredo's Rose hand lotion, and the mix is very luscious, perfect for spring. Stays close to skin, but I keep getting whiffs for the next 4-6 hours. Not FB worthy for this price however.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1519410"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1519410#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1445499" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1445499" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hsiangchi.huang"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282935"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hsiangchi.huang" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1445499ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1445499" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1282935">hsiangchi.huang</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-11-13">11/13/21 23:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Inflorescence is a sister of Jo Malone's Orange Blossom -- at least 80% identical in terms of the citrus/orange note, and the only difference is the small touch of greenness in Inflo. <br />
<br />
It's definitely one of the most (if not the most) pleasing, pretty, easy-to-understand frags from Byredo. It's also very similar to Bal d'Afrique as both have a bright uplifting and dominant citrus note.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1445499"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1445499#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1391612" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1391612" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brettashley"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/122560"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.122560.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="brettashley" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Serge-Lutens/Fils-de-Joie-62872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fils de Joie"title="Fils de Joie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1391612ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1391612" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/122560">brettashley</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-13">08/13/21 08:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This has a real dryer-sheet/fresh linens smell to me. Lily of the valley comes through heavily. I prefer my white florals with a bit more depth, a bit more indolence. I appreciate that I can smell the green of the stem as well.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1391612"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1391612#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1384801" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1384801" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RRHouse"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301056"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="RRHouse" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Juicy-Couture/Viva-La-Juicy-Luxe-Pure-Parfum-52207.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52207.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Viva La Juicy Luxe Pure Parfum"title="Viva La Juicy Luxe Pure Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1384801ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1384801" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1301056">RRHouse</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-08-01">08/01/21 07:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh dear- On my skin this reads as Glade air-freshner from the 1990s. Unnatural, cheap and heavy on Lilly of the valley.  Folks get a sample first, don't blind buy this, and get opinions before you spring for this since its $$$$.  My 3 gorgeous and completely blunt, 20- something daughters literally wrinkled up their noses and started laughing at me when I asked their opinion on this. They said wear this if you wanna smell like a sprayed bathroom, and a few other imaginative sarcastic/negative comments that I won't say on here. Disappointed.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1384801"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1384801#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1366544" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1366544" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Natashaestelle"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1271811"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1271811.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Natashaestelle" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Libre-Intense-62318.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.62318.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Libre Intense"title="Libre Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1366544ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1366544" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1271811">Natashaestelle</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-06-26">06/26/21 17:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Inflorescence feels very feminine for me with a rather complex blend of florals in the opening. But it only lasts for about 30 mins as it dries down to a realistic jasmine scent on me. I wish the opening stays on longer. This one has a much better sillage and projection than most Byredo EDPs though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1366544"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1366544#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1335255" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1335255" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stacia79"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/151903"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.151903.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stacia79" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1335255ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1335255" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/151903">stacia79</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-30">04/30/21 17:47</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lily of the valley scent is extremely nostalgic for me. These tiny bell shaped blossoms have played a role in more than a few eras of my life. But it can be a tricky note in perfumery. Luckily, Byredo Inflorescence sticks the landing flawlessly. This does not only remind me of the lily of the valley growing in the yard of my childhood home, it reminds me of the entire yard. Details I had not thought about in years.... the tiny sandbox, the plum tree, the lemon balm that took over and grew through cracks in the wooden fence. A rainy spring morning, new dresses, my first bicycle, a treasured doll. All of these details and more come through at one whiff of Inflorescence. The truest LOTV perfume I've smelled since the original version of Crabtree &amp; Evelyn's LOTV. If I were to purchase a bottle of Byredo it would either be this one or Mojave Ghost, which is also a pretty and nostalgic floral with a sweet airy mood of innocence.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1335255"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1335255#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1324226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1324226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CurrencyThat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310604"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1310604.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CurrencyThat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1324226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1324226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310604">CurrencyThat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-12">04/12/21 12:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Green &amp; fresh white floral. There's a fleeting sweetness in the opening that vanishes quickly and what I'm left with is a vastly green white floral interpretation. The greenness reminds me of fresh plant stems. It's a soft white floral but its main feature is that stem-like greenness. It's cold, not sweet (except partially in its opening), it's tart, and it's also a tad bit soapy. As much as I wanted to like it, something about this scent is slightly offensive to my olfactory. It smells unnatural, like overpowering dryer sheets or a concentrated springtime-scent detergent. For that, I wouldn't recommend as a blind-buy. I'd have a hard time going a day wearing or smelling this but the beauty of scent experiences is they can and will differ from person to person.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1324226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1324226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1316192" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1316192" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="lunarambrosia"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1128675"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1128675.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="lunarambrosia" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Flower-of-Immortality-17597.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17597.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Flower of Immortality"title="Flower of Immortality"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1316192ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1316192" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1128675">lunarambrosia</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-29">03/29/21 18:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A beautiful, modern opening of fresh lily, freesia, and rose that is gone in a flash as the lily and green notes dominate and eradicate the rest. It's a hostile takeover. The drydown is so predominantly lily and green that a deep inhalation of it leaves an almost bitter taste in my mouth. It's such a pretty fragrance in the beginning; I wish the drydown were tempered with some lactonic notes or just anything to take the edge off.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1316192"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1316192#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1311508" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1311508" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Farmgirl1979"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1299709"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1299709.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Farmgirl1979" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/Libre-Le-Parfum-75676.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.75676.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Libre Le Parfum"title="Libre Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1311508ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1311508" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1299709">Farmgirl1979</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-21">03/21/21 10:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I bought a sample of this, and fell in love with it.  It is clean, and floral.  There is a bit too much Lily in it for me, or I would get a full bottle.  It is also too expensive for a fairly common scent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1311508"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1311508#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1306910" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1306910" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="emerson10"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1238550"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="emerson10" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/ALTAIA/Don-t-Cry-For-Me-32343.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.32343.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Don't Cry For Me"title="Don't Cry For Me"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1306910ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1306910" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1238550">emerson10</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-03-12">03/12/21 22:30</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is so aldehydic to me. Opens Lily of the valley and then goes bubble bath really quickly. <br />
Fizzy, sweet, fresh.<br />
<br />
I do not mind it. If you like fresh and clean with a hint of floral, check this one out. I wouldn't wear it, but compared to the rest of the Byredos, I do like this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1306910"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1306910#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1302512" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1288459" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="denneplayer"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295931"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="denneplayer" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1288459ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1288459" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1295931">denneplayer</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-02-07">02/07/21 05:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I LOVE a lof of Byredos perfumes but I have to say that I do not like this one, unfortunately. It just reminds me of my bathroom freshener from AirWick, which I would never want to wear as a perfume... I guess that a lot of companys use these specific scents and combination with flowers for the bathrooms. Bought a tester and I just used it in my wardrobe as a air freshner. But I can imagine if you're into super floral that people would like it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1288459"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1288459#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1284816" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1284816" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="BMac99"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1136018"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="BMac99" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1284816ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1284816" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); Its wonderfully light but it makes its presence known. This is a perfume that will garner compliments. It is a very pretty perfume. That being said, its too pretty for me to wear personally. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1265075" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Nickan63"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8410"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.8410.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Nickan63" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1265075ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1265075" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/8410">Nickan63</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-12-24">12/24/20 06:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The first I thought was, wow, finally I can smell real flowers! Like sticking your nose into a magnolia flower! I hope my nose still can remember the organic smells and not only the notes in a perfume. <br />
After 10-15 minutes the rose and lily of the valley presented themselves.  Like a stroll in a beatiful blooming garden, very romantic, very fresh and kind. I use perfume for myself, and I hate living in other peoples perfume clouds, so I don't think that they have to live in mine.  I spray on my chest, so if you feel my perfume, you are too close!! ;-D So sillage and projection is nothing I really can comment on.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; <br />
Fresh, soapy floral.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1213372"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1213372#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1212458" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1212458" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jero"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72622"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.72622.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jero" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Dior-Addict-Eau-de-Toilette-25159.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.25159.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Dior Addict Eau de Toilette "title="Dior Addict Eau de Toilette "></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1212458ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1212458" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/72622">jero</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-08-16">08/16/20 20:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>to call it a flower Inflorescence is a bouqute of the magnolia, especially Magnolia grandiflora, its grand beauty, overwhelming fragrance with a hint of lemon-delicious. to call this parfum the lily of the valley it's like in the daytime under sunny blue sky. the festival lilac and splendid wisterias also come to my mind.<br />
<br />
more realistic than Paris, more optimism than Guilty, with confidence and well educated, flowers in lesser roses and the jasmine, this is the perfume I would like to wear in the daytime to bring my bouqute of beautiful flowers. it is worthy of more attention.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1212458"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1212458#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1168660" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1168660" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pepperoniann"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/82118"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.82118.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pepperoniann" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Forte-Nerolia-Vetiver-79228.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79228.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Forte Nerolia Vetiver"title="Aqua Allegoria Forte Nerolia Vetiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1168660ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1168660" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/82118">pepperoniann</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-27">04/27/20 09:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Quite an interesting one. Firs of all - Inflorescence is an extremely functional perfume. It stays crisps as it dries down, has great longevity and a moderate, but noticeable sillage. The floral profile presented here is pure enough that it wouldn't annoy most people.<br />
<br />
Now moving onto the scent itself: indeed the Byredo signature base ("cool plastic") is very prominent. The base is mixed with LLOV and magnolia at about 15/70/15 ratio. Upon spraying there's a prominent citrus tone - almost grapefruity - green and a bit bitter. Unlike many floral offerings there is no musk or wood base notes in this perfume, so what we get is endless florals pushing through. I don't particularly think of jasmine as a base - it's almost freesia, but much cleaner.<br />
<br />
Essentially a very 21st century Diorissimo. I like it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1168660"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1168660#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1167340" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1167340" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GinCatsBooks"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173750"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1173750.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GinCatsBooks" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Hypnotic-Poison-219.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.219.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hypnotic Poison"title="Hypnotic Poison"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1167340ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1167340" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1173750">GinCatsBooks</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-24">04/24/20 07:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My first Byredo and by no means is it my last.<br />
<br />
Inflorescence is a lush, sharp green fragrance, I do pull out LOTV and some magnolia, but the scent is predominantly grassy and very botanical to my nose. Theres also something which gives off a citrussy undertone in this as well, its also very, very strong!<br />
<br />
3 spritzes MAX and everyone around me could smell it, but despite it being so nuclear on my skin, its also quite inoffensive at the same time and smells very summery, it conjures up images of wearing white linen trousers and a white t-shirt and running through a wooded meadow of wild flowers and green grass<br />
<br />
Longevity is decent on my skin, I can get 7 hours out of 3 spritzes, but by 2hrs it does become quite close to skin, but throughout wear I will get little wafts of it from time to time, its really quite lovely!<br />
<br />
Overall, I'd say this is a unisex scent to my nose, it doesn't really seem to fall into either vein of being masculine or feminine smelling, it just smells good and is for people that want to smell good and feel like they're running through said wooded meadow, I love it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1167340"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1167340#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1141690" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1141690" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Adjames"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59165"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.59165.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Adjames" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Comete-90434.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.90434.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Comte"title="Comte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1141690ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1141690" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/59165">Adjames</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-04">02/04/20 21:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is a beautiful, sweet and soft Muguet perfume that I cannot stop smelling.  I dont understand the indifference.  It is a powerhouse floral with a modest profile.  It is gorgeous and light, perfect for my multiple spray days.  Dont be fooled...it is still there even though one does not smell it strongly.  Perfect for Spring and Summer office wear, but I will try it in winter as well.  It captures my attention every time I wear it.  It doesnt remind me of Jessica McClintock but it does remind me a tad of a less intense Diorissimo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1141690"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1141690#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1069032" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1193200">Kots_Tanya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-16">05/16/19 16:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is by far my favorite from three of the Byredo Ive tried(la tulipe, Blanche and this one) its a fresh floral scent, very good reflection of fresh lily of the valley and freesia, not the old fashion aldehydic but more fresh modern lily of the valley and more youthful and fresh. My problem with it is that it doesnt last long at all, 30mim-1hour and its gone. Im not sure if it is worth the high price tag but may be look for used or discounted. It reminds me a lot of jo Malone wild bluebell in the floral freshness, not quite the scent but the freshness of the perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1061149"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1061149#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1060299" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1060299" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="aveilhe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/58142"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.58142.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="aveilhe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Essential-Parfums/The-Musc-50790.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.50790.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Musc"title="The Musc"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1060299ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1060299" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/58142">aveilhe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-05-14">05/14/19 09:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>On first spray, this is a juicy, chewy floral. A floral overload! There is a definite connection between this and Diorissimo initially, particularly in the strong lilac and jasmine notes. It quickly dries down into a more soapy, green, synthetic floral. It reminds me of the sci-fi film Annihilation--flowers and plants grow in a mysterious zone where the laws of nature don't apply. Flowers glow, morph, and evolve into never before seen combinations. This is exactly how I imagine they would smell. It's a spring garden in an alien world.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1060299"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1060299#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1031785" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1031785" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="margrietmae"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1089937"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1089937.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="margrietmae" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Zara/Boldly-Seoul-70526.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70526.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Boldly Seoul"title="Boldly Seoul"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1031785ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1031785" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.89); align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1031785"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1031785#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1012167" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1012167" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sabretoothkitten"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1023551"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1023551.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sabretoothkitten" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Burberry/My-Burberry-Blush-45820.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.45820.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="My Burberry Blush"title="My Burberry Blush"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1012167ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1012167" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1023551">Sabretoothkitten</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-21">12/21/18 13:07</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I don't know if I'm crazy but aside from the lily of the valley and carnation fresh and very green opening and soapy yet I get some type of oriental resin.  Could that be the jasmine? No idea but it's very lovely. I do get something incensy...<br />
This is how I wanted Baiser Vole to be!  That one is a bit too dry, a bit powdery and well, regular Lily rather than muguet. I guess I'm a bigger fan of this Lily than that.<br />
Would be perfect in warmer weather but I'm wearing it right before Christmas.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1012167"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1012167#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1002927" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
