padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/633884">kjana</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-11-21">11/21/18 12:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>not a bad interpretation of lily of the valley - it is a juicy, womanly fragrance that might appeal to women who like wearing long skirts and walk in nature.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1002927"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1002927#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent993648" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc993648" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="what is this I don&#039;t even"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/941289"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.941289.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="what is this I don&#039;t even" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Galimard/Brindille-10702.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10702.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Brindille"title="Brindille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma993648ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd993648" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/941289">what is this I don&#039;t even</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-10-22">10/22/18 10:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I really love green lily of the valley perfumes and have a bunch.  This is sort of on a knife's edge of realistic mashed-up lily of the valley plants and fake plastic, and so I can see how some people don't like it.  Definitely if you're a lily of the valley fan there are way better options out there (Diorissimo, Envy, Live in Love, Brindille, Jaipur Bracelet, etc).  This has sort of an aloof "Scandinavian minimalism" to it.  I liked it, but it didn't last long at all and wouldn't be worth the price to me for a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="993648"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=993648#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent984607" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc984607" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="amy.yasuda@gmail.com"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/357018"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.357018.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="amy.yasuda@gmail.com" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Rose-Prick-58781.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.58781.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rose Prick"title="Rose Prick"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma984607ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd984607" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/357018"><a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection" class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="8feee2f6a1f6eefcfaebeecfe8e2eee6e3a1ece0e2">[email&#160;protected]</a></b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-09-23">09/23/18 11:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Bizarre!!!  I have been on a magnolia kick this year and sampling various scents with magnolia notes in small bottles when I can get my hands on them.  I haven't met a Byredo scent I haven't loved but don't often buy a full size bottle because they are so $$$ and I already have a pretty extensive collection(which does include Byredo Mohave Ghost- which I don't just love, I want to bathe in it, get laundry detergent and dryer sheets that smell like it.. lol etc.).  Anyhow, I have tried Inflorescence like 4 times now- I really wanted to like it and so gave it several chances.  I love how it smells on a test strip!  But on me??  First hour or so, I smell like I work in a Black Licorice factory.  NO JOKE!  It is so weird!  It's not even like an anise note- it is more like Eau de Black Twizzlers.  When I look at the pyramid of notes, I cannot for the life of me figure out what is going on!  By the time I get down to the floral notes, mostly what I can smell is Jasmine but from there it rapidly fades and there is still this lingering black licorice smell.   Anyhow, I guess this is a good reminder to always test before you buy, especially with $$$$ scents, even if they have a scent profile you love and are from one of your favorite houses!!!  Clearly something in this reacts very strangely with my chemistry.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="984607"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=984607#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent974138" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Lily of the valley dominates. Cheap smell.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="974138"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=974138#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent959668" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1020698">ashypie2004</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-07-08">07/08/18 08:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wish the floral notes would come through more on my skin. I pretty much smell like a stalk of celery from then on out.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="959668"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=959668#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent955491" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1146250">Rosemary14</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-06-24">06/24/18 14:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The opening of this fragrance is so squeaky clean, green, and STRONG that it actually hurt my teeth. Im not exaggerating it hurts my teeth every time I smell it. It screeches floral notes and has a very cold feeling. Almost like very strong cold clean water found at the bottom of a vase of flowers thats absorbed all of the smell of the stems and flowers.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="955491"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=955491#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent938413" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc938413" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tommy_girl"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1285"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1285.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tommy_girl" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rance-1795/Rue-Rance-Reve-d-Ete-43972.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43972.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Rue Rance Rve d't"title="Rue Rance Rve d't"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma938413ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd938413" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1285">tommy_girl</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-05-01">05/01/18 18:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ever heard of La fte du muguet on 1st May? Today is 1st of May and I couldn't find a better perfume to match such an occasion!<br />
I think inflorescence doesn't need lots of explanation. It's basically a beautiful bouquet of white flowers, namely muguet (lily of the valley) mixed with a touch of green notes which gives it a fresh vibe. Fortunately rose and jasmine are not dominant here, as to me they can easily get overwhelming and shift the real concept of such a perfume.<br />
I might have seen similar formulas before in a more provocative way, yet this perfume gets my admiration. It is a very mellow perfume with moderate level of eye catching factor. It's not a wow, but it lingers to get one's attention and I hope it brings me bonheur in such a beautiful day of spring.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="938413"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=938413#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent918463" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc918463" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Winter Sweet"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/265655"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.265655.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="Winter Sweet" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma918463ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd918463" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/265655">Winter Sweet</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-03-05">03/05/18 02:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Pretty! To me it is just about fresh real lilac + freesia.<br />
Reminds me of A Lilac a Day by Vilhelm Perfumerie.<br />
Also, not a flower shop scent imo. ( at least not the flower shop smell that is on my mind!)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="918463"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=918463#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent868755" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc868755" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LeFrank"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1055940"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1055940.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LeFrank" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Boy-Smells/Flor-de-la-Virgen-66841.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.66841.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Flor de la Virgen"title="Flor de la Virgen"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma868755ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd868755" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1055940">LeFrank</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-10-08">10/08/17 10:15</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Inflorescence by Byredo is predominantly a green scent, with underlying lily of the valley. A beautifully clean, fresh smell reminiscent of the tart crispness of green apples and freshly cut grass.<br />
Longevity on my skin is poor in warm weather, it fades to almost nothing within a few hours. However, in cool weather it performs much better at around five or six hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="868755"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=868755#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent817072" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc817072" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Soofiya"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/982196"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.982196.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Soofiya" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Valentino/Valentino-Donna-31411.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31411.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Valentino Donna"title="Valentino Donna"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma817072ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd817072" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/982196">Soofiya</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-04-27">04/27/17 11:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I wasn't expecting to face a big like here as I usually dislike lily of the valley dominant fragrances but something makes me wanna smell it again and again<br />
LOTV is the strongest floral note with it's creamy,green facets but I can also detect whispers of other flowers<br />
It's a very beautiful springy floral scent.simple and fresh at the same time elegant and ladylike.it reminded me forever and ever Dior which I also like.I've sprayed it six hours ago and I cab still smell it easily so while being light it's not weak or faint<br />
By far this one and rose noir are my favorite byredos but I'm not going to add them to my wantlist yet as their price tag makes me picky.I have to test it side by side with forever&amp;ever Dior and diorissimo which seems to be another similar perfume and choose one between them</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="817072"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=817072#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent804303" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc804303" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Karmalathe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1031336"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Karmalathe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Orto-Parisi/Cuoium-69923.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.69923.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Cuoium"title="Cuoium"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma804303ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd804303" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1031336">Karmalathe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-03-21">03/21/17 03:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Prominent lily of the valley - not the Diorissimo soapy affair though. Inflorescence is all about dewy, squeaky green muguet stems. The freshness of spring in a bottle. Uncomplicated, but not stupid. Very cheerful and simplistic.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="804303"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=804303#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent795767" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc795767" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Lovely_D"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1015163"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1015163.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Lovely_D" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma795767ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd795767" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1015163">Lovely_D</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2017-02-23">02/23/17 12:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume reminds me of my youth. It's one of those universally nostalgic scents that remind many of something similar. It's truly fascinating when a fragrance is able to do this. That is, to tap into a collective unconsciousness of memories. <br />
<br />
The smell evokes spring due to its extremely floral nature, but it's more versatile than that. I wear it whenever I feel like it. It's the  perfect choice for days when I want to feel fresh, clean, and feminine all at once. Another plus is that it lifts my spirits :)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="795767"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=795767#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent750443" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/949181">Russkaya1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-18">08/18/16 18:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As soon as I sprayed this beauty on my skin my memory brought me to my childhood and happy moments when I was running in the spring forest in Russia.... It was filled with blooming double buttercups ( also they are called globeflowers). It's definitely a spring scent and lasts longer in spring temperatures on me.... Unfortunately it's not a long lasting scent but I just couldn't resist it and bought a full 100 ml size anyway... Whenever I feel down I just spray it all over me and immers in happiness....<br />
I can see this perfume as perfect scent for a wedding as it's very inoffensive and delicate.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="733917"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=733917#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent719390" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Not overwhelming.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="719390"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=719390#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent650323" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc650323" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="scoovale"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/947100"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.947100.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="scoovale" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Love-in-White-4262.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4262.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Love in White"title="Love in White"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma650323ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd650323" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/947100">scoovale</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-11-22">11/22/15 08:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is so byredo: Cold, a bit distant. I noticed this in most of the byredo parfums, they are never voluptuos, crazy or passionate but more calm, cool and collected. Inflorescence is a good example. I do Like it although i can't say the same For some People around me.. Lily of the Valley is always a question of taste. in this case it is so very delicate and inoffensive. On My skin it disappears after one hour leaving a green note behind. It opens very citrusy but in a good way, Like muguet sorbet. I smell no Jasmine neither rose. But i actually Like it like this. Everytime i think of it, i see a Young woman dressed in White in a garten with a first spring sun. The only problem is that it lasts only a couple of hours on me but maybe is my skins fault, as is much too dry. If i could spend money on many parfums, maybe i would buy it. I always wanted a muguet parfum but too often they are too intense.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="650323"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=650323#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent609613" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc609613" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CaraMarie"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/931078"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="CaraMarie" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma609613ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd609613" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/931078">CaraMarie</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-07-04">07/04/15 15:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very fresh spring scent without any indoles, fecal notes, bitterness or sharpness.  To my nose this is a smooth, dewy, slightly green lily of the valley scent with just a hint of magnolia, jasmine, honeysuckle and rose.  The fragrance doesn't evolve too much and overall smells of spring florals in the rain.  This is one of those scents that isn't groundbreaking, just a very well done soft, clean floral.  I agree with others who mentioned this as a modern version of Diorissimo.  Very easy to love in my opinion</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="609613"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=609613#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent597595" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Much sweeter and not nearly as sharp.. I like this one a lot because it's truly a floral scent not tempered by anything else (citrus, woods, musk or powdery notes)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="588712"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=588712#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent588525" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc588525" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AveParfum"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.35807.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="AveParfum" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Alba-6967.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.6967.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Alba"title="Alba"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma588525ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd588525" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/35807">AveParfum</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-04-23">04/23/15 12:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Modern take on the classic Diorissimo.  I had a brand new vintage mini with the houndstooth pattern, and I gave it away to someone who treasured it more than I could.  This reminds me of it.  Really nice, green muguet; but the surprise was the enormous and very true jasmine note.  Without seeing the notes first, I thought I had hit the jackpot of jasmine perfumes.  I find the lily of the valley here to be quite realistic, as close to Diorissimo as I think I have ever encountered.  I have sampled so many from Byredo, and I am beginning to think they can do no wrong in my eyes.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="588525"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=588525#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent588394" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc588394" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tardigrada"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/842031"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.842031.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tardigrada" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma588394ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd588394" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/842031">Tardigrada</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-04-23">04/23/15 03:04</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ayax Floral Fiesta all the way. I'm sorry but I could never shake off this association. <br />
Very active and screechy muguet, and not belevable or naturalistic.  Or probably this just didn't work on my skin chemistry, because all I could get was  floral song, sung by an off-tune children's chorus. Cute, but I would never wear it again. If you want a beautiful floral from hottie Gorham, try la Tulipe, way more original and unforgettable.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="588394"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=588394#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent587807" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Not unpleasant but earthy  and dewy .</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="587807"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=587807#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent581659" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc581659" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="miracleborgtech"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/771398"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.771398.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="miracleborgtech" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jar-Parfums/Ferme-tes-Yeux-15127.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.15127.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ferme tes Yeux"title="Ferme tes Yeux"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma581659ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd581659" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/771398">miracleborgtech</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2015-03-31">03/31/15 10:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Springtime dewy Lily of the Valley, followed by an accord of roses, freesia and jasmine.  Mostly Lily of the Valley and rose though.  Sweet, delicate, subtle.  Moderate sillage and longevity.   Would like it to be stronger and longer, but overall, this is an excellent spring perfume. The fragrance is very pretty, and fresh.  The Lily of the Valley is realistic and natural smelling, right out of a woodland garden.  The hint of rose gives it a rich undertone. Uplifting, happy perfume!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="581659"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=581659#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent547024" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc547024" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="400blows"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/215766"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.215766.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="400blows" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aftelier/Absinthe-19586.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.19586.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Absinthe"title="Absinthe"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma547024ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd547024" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/215766">400blows</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-12-07">12/07/14 00:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Walking down a city lane today I caught a piercing whiff of this on a cool young thing striding out in a worldproof sound bubble. Almost wondered if it was Diorissimo, though it seemed more lemony. More like Envy. Straight to the shop then, to follow up.<br />
So for me it's been a totally addictive mix of fresh crushed stems, citrus and less-sweet flowers such as Lily of the Valley/Daphne perhaps, followed later with a dry/creamy combination that is quite strange, like freshly saddle-soaped tack spread with pulverised gardenias.  There's a magnolia tree in my garden, but that lemony peppery scent wasn't there. Rather the citrus was directly clean and zesty. People tend not to like powerful citrus. There can never be too much for me, if nothing else jars.<br />
The creamy sweet/acid note seems the one jarring element to this. It's the thing I've always recoiled from in fragrances like LouLou and Pome. Never have chased down precisely what it is. If anyone could enlighten me I'd be grateful.<br />
Still, the absolute delight of the opening notes has me hooked and the leathery dry down is interesting, so this one is under serious consideration.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="547024"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=547024#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent541093" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc541093" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="putri.daskian"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/242063"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.242063.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="putri.daskian" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/The-Smell-of-Freedom-10805.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.10805.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Smell of Freedom"title="The Smell of Freedom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma541093ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd541093" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/242063">putri.daskian</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-11-14">11/14/14 21:32</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A retail regret.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="541093"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=541093#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent521646" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc521646" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="edwardnr17"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/466959"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.466959.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="edwardnr17" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lush/Sticky-Dates-88995.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.88995.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sticky Dates"title="Sticky Dates"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma521646ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd521646" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/466959">edwardnr17</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-09-10">09/10/14 10:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is like a bar of soap.<br />
I get no LOTV, just freesia and dishwashing liquid, from the name I imagined some incensce and something darker, but this is squeaky clean for ~$200. Clean dishes from start to finish.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="521646"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=521646#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent513261" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc513261" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SundayMorning"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/202431"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.202431.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SundayMorning" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/The-Taste-of-Fragrance-Alien-13604.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.13604.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Taste of Fragrance Alien"title="The Taste of Fragrance Alien"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma513261ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd513261" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.86);
