Fresh, like the freshness you can find in, for example Herba fresca , but far to simple &amp; shortlasting for this price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="513261"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=513261#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent513055" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc513055" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="talnyc"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/63043"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.63043.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="talnyc" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma513055ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd513055" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/63043">talnyc</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-08-12">08/12/14 21:03</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Man oh man...this is one STRONG floral.  The lily of the valley dominates this fragrance.  If this is a note that you love, then this is the scent for you.<br />
<br />
My nose could not handle this at all.  The good news it that the longevity dies on this, and the jasmine and other middle/bottom notes come into play and becomes faint.<br />
<br />
Not my favorite, and there are other Muguet/Lily of the Valley scents that are better than this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="513055"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=513055#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent508343" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc508343" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maison71"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/820605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.820605.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maison71" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Comme-des-Garcons/Wonderwood-8991.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8991.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wonderwood"title="Wonderwood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma508343ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd508343" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/820605">Maison71</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-27">07/27/14 19:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an absolutely ravishing scent, flowers upon flowers, but it completely disappeared within four hours on my skin. I would probably wear this all the time if it had more of a base.<br />
<br />
EDIT: Actually, I've decided it's a perfect fragrance for warm summer days when I want a light scent without any muskiness or woodiness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="508343"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=508343#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent485060" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc485060" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Allinug"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/23086"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.23086.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Allinug" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Profumum-Roma/Sorriso-21853.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21853.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sorriso"title="Sorriso"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma485060ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd485060" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/23086">Allinug</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-05-13">05/13/14 05:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>At first a beautiful smell of Lily of the Valley and then that beautiful smell is gone. Then comes a weird smell of Lily of the Valley and the other flowers, a really bad mix, discusting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="485060"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=485060#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent441799" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc441799" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jitterbug Perfume Lover"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/534717"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.534717.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jitterbug Perfume Lover" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Schiaparelli/Shocking-4876.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.4876.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Shocking"title="Shocking"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma441799ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd441799" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/534717">Jitterbug Perfume Lover</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-01-02">01/02/14 10:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Byredo Parfums Inflorescence<br />
I like when designers take something great from the past, and give it a new twist.  One of my favorite websites is a blog called new dress a day.  Every day, this talented and creative seamstress takes a one dollar dress from the thrift store and redesigns it into a current fashion, with all the before, during, and after photos.  All of the things shes created so far have been beautiful, unique, and creative, all on the tiniest budget.  Its proof that you dont need to spend a lot of money to produce something great - the trick is to start with a great idea, find something with potential, to have enough vision to see something new in something old day after day, and to have the skills to pull it off  both technically and aesthetically.  The downside is that if your creation clings too hard to the past, its going to be hard to revision it in the present and breathe new life into it.<br />
<br />
The same could be said for this fragrance.  Inflorescence was a blind test for me and my first ever test of a Byredo perfume.  I wore it today because of the name alone.  I am wearing a dress with an embroidered floral print; so I wanted a fragrance with a strong floral heart, and the name, Inflorescence, seemed to fit.  I had no idea what a treat I was in for!  This reminds me so much of my beloved Lauren by Ralph Lauren, which has a heart of freshly picked and green mixed flowers against a background of greenery.  That fragrance is what began my obsession with green bouquets where I spent quite a bit of time exploring fragrances like Calyx and Chanel No. 19.  I absolutely love the pairing of green notes with freshly picked flowers.  Byredo has taken this same idea  a freshly picked bouquet, paired it down to just a few flowers and amped them up, and put the green notes center stage.  I would say that this is more of a bouquet of greenery with a few simple but strong flowers in focus.  On my skin, the green is so fresh and vivid and just slightly herbal.  On the first testing, I would have sworn that it had fresh cilantro and celery notes.  Later, it dries down to a rather loud and clear bouquet of super green and slightly damp lilies of the valley softened by vivid pink and coral roses.    Its absolutely lovely and a very modern twist on an old classic.  Thank you, Byredo.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="441799"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=441799#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent418644" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc418644" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gilsan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/629292"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.629292.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gilsan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Mandarine-Basilic-2060.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2060.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Mandarine Basilic"title="Aqua Allegoria Mandarine Basilic"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma418644ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd418644" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/629292">Gilsan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-10-22">10/22/13 06:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Lilly of the vally and grape peel. It smells very realystic and fresh.  Although you have to really like super flowery smells.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="418644"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=418644#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent389317" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc389317" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="L&#039;eaulita"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/125670"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.125670.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="L&#039;eaulita" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Patou/Sublime-2029.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.2029.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sublime"title="Sublime"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma389317ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd389317" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/125670">L&#039;eaulita</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-24">07/24/13 04:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very transparent minimalist scent. Cross between Antonia's Flowers and La Tulipe. Its like a hologram of a fresh bouquet- it looks real, it smells real, but its intangible. The moment you try to bury your nose in it, it disappears. Pretty expensive for a hologram of a scent, rather than a fleshed out one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="389317"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=389317#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent382506" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc382506" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Mila Pulina"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/423026"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.423026.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Mila Pulina" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Paris-Venise-49696.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.49696.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Paris  Venise"title="Paris  Venise"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma382506ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd382506" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/423026">Mila Pulina</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-07-01">07/01/13 23:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It is really a nice scent - no more - no less. For me it is a mixture of Pleasures (because of the prominent lily of the valley) and Tulipe (another fragrance of Byredo). So far I have not found anything innovative in the fragrances of Byredo - they just don't captivate me enough to become a fan.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="382506"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=382506#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent351880" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc351880" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="stephanieklein"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/450191"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.450191.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="stephanieklein" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Elisire/Oderose-44958.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.44958.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oderose"title="Oderose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma351880ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd351880" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/450191">stephanieklein</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-04-01">04/01/13 12:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So innocent and ladylike. Nothing heavy. It reminds me of a woman who's always nice. She writes thank you notes on engraved personalized stationery. She's always carrying an umbrella, in case. She's prepared, never careless, always on time, always forgiven. But she chews her fingernails, and despite what's in fashion, she always prefers things simple. Her fish is grilled, and her favorite flower is the Daisy. This smells like sunshine, like a little girl delighting in matured weeds.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="351880"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=351880#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent342795" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc342795" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="michael.j"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/427529"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.427529.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="michael.j" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma342795ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd342795" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/427529">michael.j</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-03-05">03/05/13 21:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Over a period of several weeks, I worked my way through most, if not all, of this house's work. I didn't find anything groundbreaking. All of their work is within well established idioms. The bottles are sort of nice, but they're more trendy than timeless.  I had a conversation with the person selling this line at Le Bon March in Paris and he advised me to skip it entirely and go toward more innovative houses. That's not good when the person hired to sell a line tells you you'd be better off with a less parvenu competitor.  Another "instant" house which seems to have been born overnight is Parfumerie Gnrale.  Nice stuff, but you have to wonder about a house, which is to say Pierre Guillaume, that produces so many scents so quickly.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="342795"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=342795#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                    </div>
</div>

Nothing heavy. It reminds me of a woman who's always nice. She writes thank you notes on engraved personalized stationery. She's always carrying an umbrella, in case. She's prepared, never careless, always on time, always forgiven. But she chews her fingernails, and despite what's in fashion, she always prefers things simple. Her fish is grilled, and her favorite flower is the Daisy. This smells like sunshine, like a little girl delighting in matured weeds.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="351880"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=351880#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent733917" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc733917" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Russkaya1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/949181"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.949181.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Russkaya1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Le-Labo/The-Noir-29-31872.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.31872.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Noir 29"title="The Noir 29"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma733917ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd733917" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/949181">Russkaya1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2016-08-18">08/18/16 18:13</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As soon as I sprayed this beauty on my skin my memory brought me to my childhood and happy moments when I was running in the spring forest in Russia.... It was filled with blooming double buttercups ( also they are called globeflowers). It's definitely a spring scent and lasts longer in spring temperatures on me.... Unfortunately it's not a long lasting scent but I just couldn't resist it and bought a full 100 ml size anyway... Whenever I feel down I just spray it all over me and immers in happiness....<br />
I can see this perfume as perfect scent for a wedding as it's very inoffensive and delicate.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="733917"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=733917#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent547024" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc547024" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="400blows"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/215766"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.215766.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="400blows" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Aftelier/Absinthe-19586.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.19586.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Absinthe"title="Absinthe"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma547024ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd547024" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/215766">400blows</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-12-07">12/07/14 00:40</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Walking down a city lane today I caught a piercing whiff of this on a cool young thing striding out in a worldproof sound bubble. Almost wondered if it was Diorissimo, though it seemed more lemony. More like Envy. Straight to the shop then, to follow up.<br />
So for me it's been a totally addictive mix of fresh crushed stems, citrus and less-sweet flowers such as Lily of the Valley/Daphne perhaps, followed later with a dry/creamy combination that is quite strange, like freshly saddle-soaped tack spread with pulverised gardenias.  There's a magnolia tree in my garden, but that lemony peppery scent wasn't there. Rather the citrus was directly clean and zesty. People tend not to like powerful citrus. There can never be too much for me, if nothing else jars.<br />
The creamy sweet/acid note seems the one jarring element to this. It's the thing I've always recoiled from in fragrances like LouLou and Pome. Never have chased down precisely what it is. If anyone could enlighten me I'd be grateful.<br />
Still, the absolute delight of the opening notes has me hooked and the leathery dry down is interesting, so this one is under serious consideration.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="547024"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=547024#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent508343" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc508343" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maison71"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/820605"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.820605.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maison71" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Comme-des-Garcons/Wonderwood-8991.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.8991.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Wonderwood"title="Wonderwood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma508343ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd508343" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/820605">Maison71</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2014-07-27">07/27/14 19:54</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is an absolutely ravishing scent, flowers upon flowers, but it completely disappeared within four hours on my skin. I would probably wear this all the time if it had more of a base.<br />
<br />
EDIT: Actually, I've decided it's a perfect fragrance for warm summer days when I want a light scent without any muskiness or woodiness.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="508343"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=508343#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1168660" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1168660" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="pepperoniann"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/82118"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.82118.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="pepperoniann" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Guerlain/Aqua-Allegoria-Forte-Nerolia-Vetiver-79228.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.79228.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Allegoria Forte Nerolia Vetiver"title="Aqua Allegoria Forte Nerolia Vetiver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1168660ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1168660" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/82118">pepperoniann</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-04-27">04/27/20 09:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Quite an interesting one. Firs of all - Inflorescence is an extremely functional perfume. It stays crisps as it dries down, has great longevity and a moderate, but noticeable sillage. The floral profile presented here is pure enough that it wouldn't annoy most people.<br />
<br />
Now moving onto the scent itself: indeed the Byredo signature base ("cool plastic") is very prominent. The base is mixed with LLOV and magnolia at about 15/70/15 ratio. Upon spraying there's a prominent citrus tone - almost grapefruity - green and a bit bitter. Unlike many floral offerings there is no musk or wood base notes in this perfume, so what we get is endless florals pushing through. I don't particularly think of jasmine as a base - it's almost freesia, but much cleaner.<br />
<br />
Essentially a very 21st century Diorissimo. I like it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1168660"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1168660#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="17798" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent1324226" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1324226" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="CurrencyThat"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310604"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1310604.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="CurrencyThat" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1324226ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1324226" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1310604">CurrencyThat</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-04-12">04/12/21 12:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Green &amp; fresh white floral. There's a fleeting sweetness in the opening that vanishes quickly and what I'm left with is a vastly green white floral interpretation. The greenness reminds me of fresh plant stems. It's a soft white floral but its main feature is that stem-like greenness. It's cold, not sweet (except partially in its opening), it's tart, and it's also a tad bit soapy. As much as I wanted to like it, something about this scent is slightly offensive to my olfactory. It smells unnatural, like overpowering dryer sheets or a concentrated springtime-scent detergent. For that, I wouldn't recommend as a blind-buy. I'd have a hard time going a day wearing or smelling this but the beauty of scent experiences is they can and will differ from person to person.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="1324226"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=1324226#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent737467" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Uber synthetic. Cheap smelling. Nope.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="737467"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=737467#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent955491" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; My 3 gorgeous and completely blunt, 20- something daughters literally wrinkled up their noses and started laughing at me when I asked their opinion on this. They said wear this if you wanna smell like a sprayed bathroom, and a few other imaginative sarcastic/negative comments that I won't say on here. padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc749051" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Sheza"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/992393"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.992393.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Sheza" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Kenzo/Kenzo-Jungle-L-Elephant-70.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant"title="Kenzo Jungle L'Elephant"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma749051ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd749051" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.82); I find this overwhelming, but a white floral lover may see the beauty in this. Truly encapsulates spring and the awakening of nature.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="17798"comment_id="749051"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Byredo/Inflorescence-17798.html?ccid=749051#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="17798" sentiment="negative"></reviews-infinity>

    <div class="small-12 medium-4 large-3 cell" data-sticky-container>
        <div id="offCanvasRight"
                    class="off-canvas in-canvas-for-large position-right is-closed"
             data-off-canvas>
    <div class="hide-for-large"
         style="width: 2em; position: relative; margin: 0 1em;">

    <div class="strike-title" style="margin-top: 0.5em;"><span>Perfume Encyclopedia</span></div>
<div>Perfumes: <b>98,524</b><br/>
    Fragrance Reviews: <b>1,929,606</b><br/>
    Perfume lovers: <b>1,389,102</b><br/>
    <span style="
            background: -moz-linear-gradient(left, rgba(255,255,255,1) 0%, rgba(202,230,249,0.9) 68.825806451613%, rgba(246,246,246,1) 100%);
            background: -webkit-linear-gradient(left, rgba(255,255,255,1) 0%,rgba(202,230,249,0.9) 68.825806451613%,rgba(246,246,246,1) 100%);
            background: linear-gradient(to right, rgba(255,255,255,1) 0%,rgba(202,230,249,0.9) 68.825806451613%,rgba(246,246,246,1) 100%);
            ">Online right now: <b>5,334</b></span><br/>
    <visitors-histogram :visitors='[1396,3612,1320,1372,1323,1314,3526,1336,1432,1321,1387,3362,1366,1351,1345,1343,2352,1419,1404,1455,1406,1590,1365,1412,1473,1426,1439,1446,1287]'></visitors-histogram>
</div>
            <div class="strike-title"><span>Register</span></div>

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgFr7c4b6b084f801d1036ebe90095780be1');
